result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody Resop

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:20 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - recites agreement, defendant will plea to count 2 on 2015CM12, dismiss and read-in count 1 on 2015CM12 and 2015CM1.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 2 on 2015CM12 and orders count 1 on 2015CM12 and 2015CM1 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

45 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year

CONDITIONS:

-court costs
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent

Court adjourned at 2:29 p.m.
Status hearing on February 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on January 26, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

1:53 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and requests the court read it to him.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Court determines the defendant stands mute and enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court notes bond has been set - $500.00 signature bond with conditions.  Court will set for Status Hearing in approx 3 weeks.  Defendant to sign the bond.

Court adjourned at 1:57 p.m.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.

12:34 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County jail.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court questions parents.  Court orders a $500.00 signature bond and condition of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.  Defendant to appear in court on Monday January 5, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 12:37 p.m.
